posts.post_content:
7 mana for a 10/10, in the two best colours for mana acceleration, seems good enough to me. I don't think it's spectacular, but worth playing in a fair number of decks and especially in limited.  
  
The second ability is more bonus gravy than a key part of the card. It's not essential, but it's certainly nice.
posts.html:

The second ability is more bonus gravy than a key part of the card. It's not essential, but it's certainly nice.

posts.post_content:
Ok... let me get this straight, with a mana boosting deck I can call out a 10/10 for 7, and then give it -3/-3 the next turn to deal 3 damage to a creature or player for 6 mana...  
  
While the burn effect is a little costly, I don't think many players are going to care...  
  
Unblocked (god help you if it somehow becomes unblockable or gains trample.) at 7 mana i hit you with 10 and burn you for 3 on the same turn...next turn (if it lives three turns your opponent is stupid or has nothing in ways of creature removal.) I hit you for 7 and burn you 3 more...  
  
wow... just... wow... he is a huge hitter... but a word of advice, don't count on him TOO much to win you the game, there will be those jerks with O-ring, terror, celestial purge, etc that will kill him and if you dumped all your mana into him they are going to laugh at you...   
  
Give it haste and watch the fun, or play one of those cards that go off a creature's power... "I hit you with a 10/10 and then I play soul's Majesty and draw 10 ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Belz_ (8/17/2009 3:34:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think the pinging ability should have been replaced by either Reach or Trample (like said before) or the ability to block any number of creatures (although it's not really seen as being a creature you'd rather block with, so that might not be very useful). Trample or Reach would've been the best replacement I think.  
  
And this card is pretty sweet overall, except for the fact that it is quite vulnerable to removal (a [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) would make it an absolute beast). I'll give it a 4/5. Also, I just used it in a game and made it a 12/12, but my opponent used [Act of Treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Treason) on it, and attacked me with all he had and killed me :(
posts.html:

Posted By: True_Mumin (6/13/2009 6:48:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've been killed by this card several times.  
Has anyone done this?:  
Play [Doubling Cube](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Cube).  
Play [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season).  
Play this card and pay whatever you can for X.  
[Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) doubles the number of tokens, as does this card's effect. Doubling cube increases how much you can pump into X.  
  
Only problem?  
Why the ping effect (that other one where you can remove the counters to do damage?)  
Not only is it not necessary, but doesn't make sense from a Vorthos standpoint (What does that damage represent? Chucking the heads at your opponent?)
posts.html:
I've been killed by this card several times.
Has anyone done this?:
Play Doubling Cube.
Play Doubling Season.
Play this card and pay whatever you can for X.
Doubling Season doubles the number of tokens, as does this card's effect. Doubling cube increases how much you can pump into X.

Only problem?
Why the ping effect (that other one where you can remove the counters to do damage?)
Not only is it not necessary, but doesn't make sense from a Vorthos standpoint (What does that damage represent? Chucking the heads at your opponent?)

Posted By: InfernoTowel (6/12/2009 8:12:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is near perfection. Now while the cost to some people may seem absurd, in reality green decks have tons of mana accleration; which means this guy could easily be a 12/12 by turn four. His second ability is good, but mabye a little too expensive at 2 mana. The art work couldn't be better; seeing the soldiers of Bant get destroyed by one of Naya's most vicious creatures is awesome. But aside from all the good points about the Hydra, I must go on to explain the bad, which keep the card from being entirely perfect. First there is little protection from removal. Its obvious that burn spells won't even sting this guy, but everything from [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate) to [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile ) will easily make all that mana investment vain. Seconly, the X cost prevents the Hydra from being played with cascade or reanimation combos effectively. Aside from the downsides however, Apocalypse Hydra is still an amazing monstrosity that will make your opponents quiver ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
